title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8200-2.1 - Reports
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8200-2.1 - Reports

State Regulations
(a) All railroad
companies shall file the following reports with ORPTS, at the time specified in
subdivision (b) of this section. The reports shall include the following
information: (1)

Form RPRR-V - Verification, including: (i) the types of reports
filed; (ii)
the number of pages in
each; (iii)
in what form (e.g., excel, foxpro, etc.) the reports are submitted; (iv)
a statement of the reporting period; and
(v) verification by a duly
authorized officer of the company. (2)

Form RPRR-1 Structural Property. This
form reports all railroad transportation structural property, constructed at
railroad company expense, to which costs can be directly assigned. It includes
the following information: (i) identification
by account; (ii)
chaining
station; (iii)
SWIS code
number; (iv)
item number; (v) valuation section; (vi)
structure number; (vii)
the year built; (viii)
inventory or addition; (ix)
retirements; (x) net original cost; (xi)
AFE number; (xii)
file code; and
(xiii)
a brief description of the
item. (3)

Form RPRR-1.4

Exempt Reconstruction Structural Property, which lists railroad transportation
property claimed to be exempt under subdivision 2 or 3 of sections
489-d
and
489-dd
of the Real Property Tax Law. This report shall include the same types
of information required on form RPRR-1, described in paragraph (2) of this
subdivision. (4)

Form RPRR-3 Land

Report. This is a report of land and land rights held in New York State, and
includes the following information: (i) ICC
map number; (ii)
valuation
section; (iii)
former valuation
section; (iv)
appraisal
number; (v) subzone; (vi)
SWIS code; (vii)
school district; (viii)
(section) block and lot number; (ix)
transaction year; (x) railroad map number(s); (xi)
ICC zone number; (xii)
land class; (xiii)
transaction area code; (xiv)
area; (xv)
unit value; (xvi)
total in dollars; (xvii)
development code; (xviii)
unit value code; (xix)
report year; (xx)
file code; and
(xxi)
railroad code. (5)

Form RPRR-6 - Mass Inventory Report, including: (i) item number; (ii)
class of track; (iii)
SWIS code; (iv)
chaining station identifiers; (v) road miles; (vi)
main track miles; (vii)
sidetrack miles; (viii)
fence miles; (ix)
communications miles; (x) signal miles; (xi)
electrified track miles; (xii)
main track turnouts; (xiii)
sidetrack turnouts; (xiv)
single slip switches; (xv)
double slip switches; (xvi)
crossing frogs; (xvii)
common cut, in cubic yards; (xviii)
common fill, in cubic
yards; (xix)
loose rock, in cubic
yards; (xx)
solid rock, in cubic
yards; (xxi)
val section; (xxii)
file code; and
(xxiii)
year installed. (6)

Form RPRR-30 - Revenues and Expense, including: (i) railway operating
revenues; (ii)
railway operating
expenses; (iii)
rental
income; (iv)
rent
expense; (v) miscellaneous and
extraordinary income; (vi)
miscellaneous and extraordinary expenses; (vii)
railroad retirement taxes; (viii)
unemployment insurance
taxes; (ix)
property taxes; and
(x) other taxes; (xi)
car hire income; (xii)
car hire expense; and
(xiii)
equipment lease and rentals. (b) These reports shall
be filed on or before September 1st annually. (c) In addition to the reports required by
subdivision (a) of this section, each railroad company shall file with ORPTS by

July 1st a copy of its annual report, or if combined with another railroad, a
copy of its combined report, filed with the Surface Transportation Board or the

New York State Department of Transportation, as the case may be. (d) The information required by the preceding
sections of this Subpart may be submitted on paper, excel, foxpro, etc. or in
any other form mutually agreed upon by the railroad company and
ORPTS. (e) For good cause shown, upon written request, ORPTS may extend the time for filing of any of these
reports. Notes
